member.name: T:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.MobileAnalyticsManager.MobileAnalyticsManagerConfig
member.summary: Represents configuration for Mobile Analytics Manager.

member.name: M:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.MobileAnalyticsManager.MobileAnalyticsManagerConfig.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor of

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.MobileAnalyticsManager.MobileAnalyticsManagerConfig.ClientContextConfiguration
member.summary: Client Context Configuration .

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.MobileAnalyticsManager.MobileAnalyticsManagerConfig.SessionTimeout
member.summary: If the app stays in background for a time greater than the SessionTimeout then Mobile Analytics client stops old session and creates a new session once app comes back to foreground. We recommend using values ranging from 5 to 10,

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.MobileAnalyticsManager.MobileAnalyticsManagerConfig.MaxDBSize
member.summary: Gets the max size of the database used for local storage of events. Event Storage will ignore new events if the size of database exceed this size. Value is in Bytes. We recommend using values ranging from 1MB to 10MB

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.MobileAnalyticsManager.MobileAnalyticsManagerConfig.DBWarningThreshold
member.summary: The Warning threshold. The values range between 0 - 1. If the values exceed beyond the threshold then the Warning logs will be generated.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.MobileAnalyticsManager.MobileAnalyticsManagerConfig.MaxRequestSize
member.summary: The maximum size of the requests that can be submitted in every service call. Value can range between 1-512KB (expressed in long). Value is in Bytes. Attention: Do not use value larger than 512KB. May cause service to reject your Http request.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.MobileAnalyticsManager.MobileAnalyticsManagerConfig.AllowUseDataNetwork
member.summary: A value indicating whether service call is allowed over data network Setting this property to true may increase customer's data usage.

member.name: T:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.MobileAnalyticsManager.Internal.BackgroundRunner
member.summary: Amazon Mobile Analytics background runner. Background runner periodically calls delivery client to send events to server.
Amazon Mobile Analytics background runner. Background runner periodically calls delivery client to send events to server.

member.name: M:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.MobileAnalyticsManager.Internal.BackgroundRunner.StartWork
member.summary: Starts the Mobile Analytics Manager background thread.

member.summary: Objects that represnets constants used in Mobile Analytics

member.name: T:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.MobileAnalyticsManager.Internal.DeliveryClient
member.summary: Delivery client periodically sends events in local persistent storage to Mobile Analytics server. Once the events is delivered successfully, those events would be deleted from local storage.
Delivery client periodically sends events in local persistent storage to Mobile Analytics server. Once the events is delivered successfully, those events would be deleted from local storage.
Constructor of class.

member.name: M:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.MobileAnalyticsManager.Internal.DeliveryClient.EnqueueEventsForDelivery(Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event)
member.summary: Enqueues the events for delivery. The event is stored in an instance of .

member.name: M:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.MobileAnalyticsManager.Internal.DeliveryClient.AttemptDelivery
member.summary: Attempts the delivery. Delivery will fail if any of the policies IsAllowed() returns false. The delivery are attmpted in batches of fixed size. To increase or decrease the size, you can override MaxRequestSize in MobileAnalyticsManagerConfig.

member.name: M:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.MobileAnalyticsManager.Internal.DeliveryClient.SubmitEvents(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.List{Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event})
member.summary: Submits a single batch of events to the service.
member.param: Row identifiers. The list of rowId, that is unique identifier of each event.
The list of events that need to be submitted.

member.summary: The constructor of MobileAnalyticsErrorEventArgs
member.param: The class name where the error is caught.
The message that describes reason of the error.
The exception thrown in Mobile Analytics Manager.

member.summary: Converts to mobile analytics model event.

member.name: T:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event
member.summary: A JSON object representing a batch of unique event occurrences in your app.

member.name: M:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event.MarshallToJson
member.summary: Creates a Json string from the Event. Expects Event and Session Timestamps to be in UTC.

member.name: M:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event.UnmarshallFromJson(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an Event object from Json.
member.param: The Json string representing the Event.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event.Attributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
A collection of key-value pairs that give additional context to the event. The key-value pairs are specified by the developer.
This collection can be empty or the attribute object can be omitted.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event.EventType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventType.
A name signifying an event that occurred in your app. This is used for grouping and aggregating like events together for reporting purposes.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event.Metrics
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Metrics.
A collection of key-value pairs that gives additional, measurable context to the event. The key-value pairs are specified by the developer.
This collection can be empty or the attribute object can be omitted.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event.Session
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Session.
The session the event occured within.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event.Timestamp
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Timestamp.
The time the event occurred in ISO 8601 standard date time format. For example, 2014-06-30T19:07:47.885Z

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event.Version
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Version.
The version of the event.

member.name: T:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.PutEventsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutEvents operation. The PutEvents operation records one or more events. You can have up to 1,500 unique custom events per app, any combination of up to 40 attributes and metrics per custom event, and any number of attribute or metric values.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.PutEventsRequest.ClientContext
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientContext.
The client context including the client ID, app title, app version and package name.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.PutEventsRequest.ClientContextEncoding
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientContextEncoding.
The encoding used for the client context.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.PutEventsRequest.Events
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Events.
An array of Event JSON objects

member.name: T:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.PutEventsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutEvents operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Session
member.summary: Describes the session. Session information is required on ALL events.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Session.Duration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Duration.
The duration of the session.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Session.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
A unique identifier for the session

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Session.StartTimestamp
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartTimestamp.
The time the event started in ISO 8601 standard date time format. For example, 2014-06-30T19:07:47.885Z

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Session.StopTimestamp
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StopTimestamp.
The time the event terminated in ISO 8601 standard date time format. For example, 2014-06-30T19:07:47.885Z

member.name: T:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing MobileAnalytics
Amazon Mobile Analytics is a service for collecting, visualizing, and understanding app usage data at scale.

member.name: M:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient.#ctor(Amazon.MobileAnalytics.AmazonMobileAnalyticsConfig)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient.PutEvents(Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.PutEventsRequest)
member.summary: The PutEvents operation records one or more events. You can have up to 1,500 unique custom events per app, any combination of up to 40 attributes and metrics per custom event, and any number of attribute or metric values.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutEvents service method.
member.returns: The response from the PutEvents service method, as returned by MobileAnalytics.
member.exception: An exception object returned when a request fails.

member.name: M:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient.BeginPutEvents(Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.PutEventsRequest,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Initiates the asynchronous execution of the PutEvents operation.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutEvents operation on AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient.
An AsyncCallback delegate that is invoked when the operation completes.
A user-defined state object that is passed to the callback procedure. Retrieve this object from within the callback procedure using the AsyncState property.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult that can be used to poll or wait for results, or both; this value is also needed when invoking EndPutEvents operation.

member.name: M:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient.EndPutEvents(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Finishes the asynchronous execution of the PutEvents operation.
member.param: The IAsyncResult returned by the call to BeginPutEvents.
member.returns: Returns a PutEventsResult from MobileAnalytics.
